item.description:
<blockquote> <p>é»˜è®¤<code>QNAP</code>æ˜¯ä¸å¸¦<code>man</code>å‘½ä»¤çš„ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ï¼Œä½œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ª<code>Linux</code>é‡åº¦ç”¨æˆ·æ€ä¹ˆèƒ½å¿ï¼Ÿå¾—æƒ³åŠæ³•å®‰è£…manå•Šï¼ç»è¿‡ä¸€ç•ªåŠªåŠ›ï¼Œæœ€ç»ˆæˆåŠŸå®‰è£…man pages!</p> </blockquote> <p><img src="https://cimg1.17lai.site/data/2022/04/2120220421192048.svg" alt=""></p> <h2 id="éœ€æ±‚">éœ€æ±‚</h2> <p>é»˜è®¤<code>QNAP</code>æ˜¯ä¸å¸¦<code>man</code>å‘½ä»¤çš„ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ï¼Œä½œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ª<code>Linux</code>é‡åº¦ç”¨æˆ·æ€ä¹ˆèƒ½å¿ï¼Ÿ</p> <blockquote> <p>å¾—æƒ³åŠæ³•å®‰è£…manå•Šï¼</p> </blockquote> <h2 id="éªŒè¯">éªŒè¯</h2> <p>å…ˆè¯•ä¸€ä¸‹</p> <pre class="line-numbers language-bash" data-language="bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="token comment"># man</span> -sh: man: <span class="token builtin class-name">command</span> not found<span aria-hidden="true" class="line-numbers-rows"><span></span><span></span></span></code></pre> <p>åŸºæœ¬å¯ä»¥æ­»å¿ƒäº†ã€‚</p> <p>çœ‹çœ‹busyboxç‰ˆæœ¬</p> <pre class="line-numbers language-bash" data-language="bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="token comment"># /bin/busybox </span> BusyBox v1.24.1 <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">2022</span>-03-24 03:13:07 CST<span class="token punctuation">)</span> multi-call binary. BusyBox is copyrighted by many authors between <span class="token number">1998</span>-2015. Licensed under GPLv2. See <span class="token builtin class-name">source</span> distribution <span class="token keyword">for</span> detailed copyright notices.
Usage: busybox <span class="token punctuation">[</span>function <span class="token punctuation">[</span>arguments<span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">..</span>.<span class="token punctuation">]</span> or: busybox --list or: <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>arguments<span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">..</span>.
BusyBox is a multi-call binary that combines many common Unix utilities into a single executable. Most people will create a <span class="token function">link</span> to busybox <span class="token keyword">for</span> each <span class="token keyword">function</span> they wish to use and BusyBox will act like whatever it was invoked as.
Currently defined functions: <span class="token punctuation">[</span>, <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token punctuation">[</span>, addgroup, adduser, arping, ash, awk, base64, id="è§£å†³æ€è·¯">è§£å†³æ€è·¯</h2> <ul> <li>ç»™<code>QNAP</code>æéœ€æ±‚å•ï¼Ÿ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªé€‰æ‹©ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¤ªæ…¢äº†ï¼Œæƒ³å®˜æ–¹å†…ç½®ï¼Œä¸çŸ¥é“ç­‰åˆ°çŒ´å¹´é©¬æœˆäº†ã€‚</li> <li><code>QNAP</code>ä¼¼ä¹å¼€å‘äº†åº•å±‚SDKï¼Œè®°å¾—æœ‰ä¸‹è½½è¿‡ï¼Œè¿˜æ²¡æœ‰ä»”ç»†ç id="å»çœ‹çœ‹åˆ«äººæœ‰å•¥è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Ÿ">å»çœ‹çœ‹åˆ«äººæœ‰å•¥è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Ÿ</h2> <blockquote> <p>Optware has man but only for the optware installed packages (if supplied) and or manually added files in the man folder.</p> <p>https://forum.qnap.com/viewtopic.php?t=49961</p> </blockquote> <p>æŸ³æš—èŠ±æ˜åˆä¸€æ‘ï¼Œ <code>entware</code> æ”¯æŒ<code>man pages</code>ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ç›´æ¥å®‰è£…äº†ã€‚</p> <blockquote> <p>æ’å…¥<code>entware</code>å®‰è£…æ–¹æ³•ï¼š</p> <p>æ‰“å¼€<code>App Center</code>ï¼Œæºé€‰æ‹©åˆšæ·»åŠ çš„<code>Qnapclub</code>ï¼Œç‚¹å‡»æœç´¢æ¡†è¾“å…¥<code>entware</code>ï¼Œé€‰<code>Entware-std 1.03</code></p> </blockquote> <p>ä¸€æ¡å‘½ä»¤è§£å†³ï¼š</p> <pre class="line-numbers language-bash" data-language="bash"><code class="language-bash">opkg <span class="token function">install</span> man-db man-pages<span aria-hidden="true" class="line-numbers-rows"><span></span></span></code></pre> <p>å®‰è£…å®Œä¹‹åéªŒè¯ï¼š</p> <pre class="line-numbers language-bash" data-language="bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="token comment"># man fopen</span> FOPEN<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">3</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Linux Programmer's Manual FOPEN<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">3</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
NAME fopen, fdopen, freopen - stream <span class="token function">open</span> functions
SYNOPSIS <span class="token comment">#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;</span>
FILE *fopen<span class="token punctuation">(</span>const char *restrict pathname, const char *restrict mode<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> FILE *fdopen<span class="token punctuation">(</span>int fd, const char *mode<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> FILE *freopen<span class="token punctuation">(</span>const char *restrict pathname, const char *restrict mode, FILE *restrict stream<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span>
Feature Test Macro Requirements <span class="token keyword">for</span> glibc <span class="token punctuation">(</span>see feature_test_macros<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">7</span><span class="token punctuation">))</span>:
fdopen<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>: _POSIX_C_SOURCE
DESCRIPTION The fopen<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> opens the <span class="token function">file</span> whose name is the string pointed to by pathname and associates a stream with it.
The argument mode points to a string beginning with one of the following sequences <span class="token punctuation">(</span>possibly followed by additional charâ€ acters, as described below<span class="token punctuation">)</span>:
r Open text <span class="token function">file</span> <span class="token keyword">for</span> reading. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
r+ Open <span class="token keyword">for</span> reading and writing. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
w Truncate <span class="token function">file</span> to zero length or create text <span class="token function">file</span> <span class="token keyword">for</span> writing. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
w+ Open <span class="token keyword">for</span> reading and writing. The <span class="token function">file</span> is created <span class="token keyword">if</span> it does not exist, otherwise it is truncated. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.<span aria-hidden="true" class="line-numbers-rows"><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span><span></span></span></code></pre> punctuation">)</span> GitHub CLI manual GH<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
NAME gh - GitHub CLI
SYNOPSIS gh <span class="token operator">&lt;</span>command<span class="token operator">&gt;</span> <span class="token operator">&lt;</span>subcommand<span class="token operator">&gt;</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>flags<span class="token punctuation">]</span>
DESCRIPTION Work seamlessly with GitHub from the <span class="token builtin class-name">command</span> line.
CORE COMMANDS gh-auth<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Authenticate gh and <span class="token function">git</span> with GitHub
gh-browse<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Open the repository <span class="token keyword">in</span> the browser
gh-codespace<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Connect to and manage your codespaces
gh-gist<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Manage gists
gh-issue<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Manage issues
gh-pr<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Manage pull requests
gh-release<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Manage releases
gh-repo<span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> Manage repositories
ACTIONS COMMANDS<span aria-hidden="true"
